current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To promote research, development, and demonstration of
		  marine and hydrokinetic renewable energy technologies, and for other
		  purposes.

committee-name.#text:
Committee on Energy and Natural
			 Resources

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the
			 following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

short-title.#text:
Marine and Hydrokinetic
			 Renewable Energy Act of 2013

text.#text:
This Act may be cited
			 as the
The table of contents of this Act is as follows:

toc-entry.#text:
Sec. 1. Short title; table of
				contents.

TITLE I—Marine and hydrokinetic renewable energy
				technologies

Sec. 101. Definition of marine and hydrokinetic renewable
				energy.

Sec. 102. Marine and hydrokinetic renewable energy research and
				development.

Sec. 103. National Marine Renewable Energy Research,
				Development, and Demonstration Centers.

TITLE II—Marine and hydrokinetic renewable energy regulatory
				efficiency

Sec. 201. Marine and hydrokinetic renewable energy projects and
				facilities.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended in the matter preceding

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Section 632 of the Energy Independence and
			 Security Act of 2007
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Energy Independence and Security Act of 2007/s:632

header.#text:
Definition of
			 marine and hydrokinetic renewable energy

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended to read as follows:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Section 633 of the Energy Independence and
			 Security Act of 2007
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Energy Independence and Security Act of 2007/s:633

header.#text:
Marine and
			 hydrokinetic renewable energy research and development

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, shall carry out a program of research, development,
				demonstration, and commercial application to expand marine and hydrokinetic
				renewable energy production, including programs—

text.#text: The

header.#text:
Marine and
				hydrokinetic renewable energy research and development

text.#text:
to assist
				technology development to improve the components, processes, and systems used
				for power generation from marine and hydrokinetic renewable energy
				resources;

to establish
				critical testing infrastructure necessary—

to cost
				effectively and efficiently test and prove marine and hydrokinetic renewable
				energy devices; and

to accelerate the
				technological readiness and commercialization of those devices;

to support
				efforts to increase the efficiency of energy conversion, lower the cost,
				increase the use, improve the reliability, and demonstrate the applicability of
				marine and hydrokinetic renewable energy technologies by participating in
				demonstration projects;

to increase the
				reliability and survivability of marine and hydrokinetic renewable energy
				technologies, including development of corrosion-resistant and anti-fouling
				materials;

to verify the
				performance, reliability, maintainability, and cost of new marine and
				hydrokinetic renewable energy device designs and system components in an
				operating environment;

to identify
				opportunities for joint research and development programs and development of
				economies of scale between—

marine and
				hydrokinetic renewable energy technologies; and

other renewable
				energy and fossil energy programs, offshore oil and gas production activities,
				and activities of the

to support
				in-water technology development with international partners using existing
				cooperative procedures (including memoranda of understanding)—

to encourage the
				participation of international research centers and companies in the United
				States and the participation of research centers and companies of the United
				States in international
				projects.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Energy Independence and Security Act of 2007/s:634/ss:b

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Section 634 of the
			 Energy Independence and Security Act of 2007
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Energy Independence and Security Act of 2007/s:634

header.#text:
National
			 Marine Renewable Energy Research, Development, and Demonstration
			 Centers

text.#text:
The
				Centers (in coordination with the

support in-water
				testing and demonstration of marine and hydrokinetic renewable energy
				technologies, including facilities capable of testing—

a variety of
				technologies in multiple test berths at a single location; and

arrays of
				technology devices; and

serve as
				information clearinghouses for the marine and hydrokinetic renewable energy
				industry by collecting and disseminating information on best practices in all
				areas relating to developing and managing marine and hydrokinetic renewable
				energy resources and energy
				systems.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Section 636
			 of the Energy Independence and Security Act of 2007
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Energy Independence and Security Act of 2007/s:636

header.#text:
Marine and
			 hy­dro­ki­net­ic renewable en­er­gy technologies

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended by adding at the end the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Part I of the Federal Power Act

header.#text:
Marine and
			 hydrokinetic renewable energy projects and facilities

Pilot license
				for marine and hydrokinetic renewable energy projects

term.#tail: means a facility that generates energy from—

text.#text: In this section, the term

waves, tides, or
				currents in an ocean, estuary, or tidal area; or

free-flowing
				water in a river, lake, or stream.

term.#tail:
does not include a project that
				uses a dam or other impoundment for electric power purposes.

text.#text:
The
				term

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may issue a pilot license to construct,
				operate, and maintain a hydrokinetic pilot project that meets the criteria
				listed in

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may issue a pilot license for a
				hydrokinetic pilot project if the project—

text.#text: The

will have an
				installed capacity of not more than 10 megawatts;

is for a term of
				not more than 10 years;

will not cause a
				significant adverse environmental impact or interfere with navigation;

can be removed,
				and the site can be restored, by the end of the license term, unless the
				project has obtained a new license or the Commission has determined, based on
				substantial evidence, that the project should not be removed because it would
				be preferable for environmental or other reasons not to; and

is primarily for
				the purpose of—

testing new
				hydrokinetic technologies;

locating
				appropriate sites for new hydrokinetic technologies; or

determining the
				environmental and other effects of a hydrokinetic technology.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall act as
				the lead agency—

to coordinate all
				applicable Federal authorizations; and

to comply with

receives a completed application, and following consultation with
				Federal, State, and local agencies with jurisdiction over the hydrokinetic
				pilot project, the

shall develop and issue pilot license approval
				process scheduling goals that cover all Federal, State, and local permits

text.#text: Not later than 30 days after the date on which the

to the maximum extent practicable, consistent with

Applicable

and the other

text.#text: It shall be the goal of the

may grant a pilot license for a project
				located in the ocean if the project covers a surface area of not more than 1

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
and for good cause, may grant a
				pilot license for a project that covers a surface area of more than 1 square
				nautical mile.

text.#text: The

shall determine the size limit on a case-by-case basis, taking
				into account all relevant factors.

text.#text:
For
				proposed projects located in an estuary, tidal area, river, lake, or stream,
				the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
may make a
				1-time extension of a pilot license for a term not to exceed 5
